results.title: Making the news; ABC news
results.brief_description: A two-part look at the production of ABC television news. In the first part Mary Delahunty takes us on a behind-the-scenes tour of the selection and production processes involved in the presentation of the news. The second part of the video is the actual news program which we have seen being put together in the first part.

results.title: Making the News
results.brief_description: Making the news is the most detailed study yet made of how a modern television newsroom operates. This video goes into detail of the technology resources, planning and decision making that makes up the production of a television news bulletin. Follow the role of each key player in the newsroom - the chief of staff, news director, journalists, camera-crews, network executives and graphics department. The video comprises seven segments:- Making the news; The bulletin; The reporter; Technology; Decisions; The presenters; Reflections on telling the news. Introduced by Mary Delahunty. A Teacher’s guide which includes question and stimulus sheets is available to accompany the video.

results.title: Making the most of your leisure
results.brief_description: The Sport and Recreation Service of New South Wales has centres throughout the state which encourage both adults and children to make the most of their leisure time. Specialised staff at the centres give instruction in many sports including: canoeing, archery, swimming lessons for adults, golf, skiing at Jindabyne in winter. Not only are active sports encouraged, but also the less active games such as chess.

results.title: Making the most of the micro: Parts 6-10
results.brief_description: Sequel to Parts 1-5 of the same title. Part 6: “Getting down to business” examines the pros and cons of system design and the role of expert advice from commercial software houses. 7: “Sounds interesting” addresses the micro making sounds and music. 8: “Everything under control” discusses the micro controlling equipment. 9: “Moving pictures”. 10: “At the end of the line” is about telephones and micros.

results.title: Making the Most of the Micro: Parts 1-5
results.brief_description: Designed for new microcomputer users. Part 1: “The Versatile Machine” 2: “Getting Down to Basic” deals with writing a computer program in BASIC. 3: “Strings and Things” addresses the ability of the microcomputer to handle words as well as numbers. 4: “Introducing graphics” 5: “Keeping a Record”

results.title: Making television
results.creator_credit: Cilla Ware, Adrienne Jones and Thames Television
results.brief_description: A behind the scenes view of what is involved in the making of a children’s television program. Students can witness first hand the entire process from the conception of an idea to the end product in production. ‘Making television’ begins with the script writers (Grant Cathro and Lee Pressman) in search of an idea, then follows the process through to rehearsals and conferences. The actors involved discuss their perceptions of the characters they play, and the director gives us an idea of their role in bringing all the disparate elements together at the filming stage. The value of the studio is emphasised while set design and special effects are also explored.

results.title: Making sure-footed friends
results.brief_description: The film shows the design and manufacture of tyres designed for use in Australian conditions. The many safety tests which the tyres are put through before sale are also shown.
